answers.answer: It sounds like peripheral neuropathy, which is one of the complications of diabetes. If your blood sugars are not controlled you might want to tighten your control and you should see some improvement or at least stop the progression of the neuropathy. I would see your endo and see what he advises to help you with the symptoms.

question: I am a 45yr old woman with type 1 Diabetes , lately i have been suffering from awful pins and needles in my hands and arms,the tips of my fingers are also going very numb this is weather i am active or asleep its not painful but can be very sore and takes a long time to go away any answers would be greatly appreciated.
title: pins and needles
